body:
The compiler names in Spack specs can be overly long; thereby making it hard to work with.  Consider the output below, for example.

Would it be possible to create nicknames / aliases for compilers?  Or else remove all the options from the spec, assuming the user *already* properly put that information into `compilers:compiler:spec` in `compilers.yaml`?  Or any other way to make this easier to use???

```
 -   lskgrvl  petsc@3.5.3%intel@18.0.4 cflags="-gcc-name=/usr/local/other/SLES11.3/gcc/5.3.0/bin/gcc" cxxflags="-gxx-name=/usr/local/other/SLES11.3/gcc/5.3.0/bin/g++" ~X clanguage=C ~complex~debug+double~fortran+hdf5+hypre~int64+metis+mpi+mumps+shared~suite-sparse~superlu-dist~trilinos arch=linux-suse_linux11-x86_64
```

title: Overly-Long Compiler Names
